    • Field Detail

      • deleteJB

        protected javax.swing.JButton deleteJB
        deleteJB is the JButton in the GUI labeled Delete. Its functionality is the same as the Message menu item with the same name.

      • replyJB

        protected javax.swing.JButton replyJB
        replyJB is the JButton in the GUI labeled Reply. Its functionality is the same as the Message menu item with the same name.

      • sendTextJB

        protected javax.swing.JButton sendTextJB
        sendTextJB is the JButton in the GUI labeled Send Text. Its functionality is the same as the Message menu item with the same name.

      • sendCipherJB

        protected javax.swing.JButton sendCipherJB
        sendCipherJB is the JButton in the GUI labeled Send Cipher. Its functionality is the same as the Message menu item with the same name.

      • messageListJL

        protected javax.swing.JList<java.lang.String> messageListJL
        messageList is the JList the displays the message "from and time" in the left pane of the window.

      • messageContentJTA

        protected javax.swing.JTextArea messageContentJTA
        The JTextArea to display the contents of messages. Message contents can contain the information received or in composition. messageContentJTA is the Gui component on the right side of the window's split pane.

      • messageStatusJTA

        protected javax.swing.JTextArea messageStatusJTA
        The JTextArea to display the status of messages. Message status can contain the information describing signature verification. messageStatusJTA is the Gui component on the right side of the window's split pane in the lower section.

      • toJTF

        protected javax.swing.JTextField toJTF
        toJTF is the JTextField containing the message text for Header To:

      • fromJTF

        protected javax.swing.JTextField fromJTF
        fromJTF is the JTextField containing the message text Header labelled From:

      • subjectJTF

        protected javax.swing.JTextField subjectJTF
        subjectJTF is the JTextField containing the message text for Header Subject.

      • dateJTF

        protected javax.swing.JTextField dateJTF
        dateJTF is the JTextField containing the message date, which is used as the latter portion of the Header its label is Date:

      • menuNames

        protected java.lang.String[] menuNames
        Array of strings naming the menus: File, and Message. The array's value is: {"File", "Message"},

      • actions

        protected java.lang.String[][] actions
        Array of strings naming the action commands for File, and Message menus. The array's value is: {{"Get Mail","Exit"}, {"Delete","Reply","Send Text","Send Cipher"}}; actions[0] is an array containing the names of actions for File menu actions[2] is an array containing the names of actions for Message menu

      • userMenuItems

        protected javax.swing.JMenuItem[][] userMenuItems
        The menu items. Each entry in the array is a JMenuItem object. Note: order and cardinality of userMenuItems matches the actions array. Each entry in userMenuItems corresponds to a menu pull-down item. So, for example: userMenuItems[1][2].addActionListener(this); causes the calling object's actionPerformed method to be called when the user selects the Message menu item Delete.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageGui

        public MessageGui(java.lang.String author,
                  java.lang.String user)
        The constructor for MessageGui View objects. Student clients (Controllers) call this constructor to create gui objects which their class subsequently controls. Visibility to the gui controls is provided by defining them as protected. Both parameters end up in the title bar of the window (JFrame) created by MessageSignerGui.
        Parameters:
        author - The string naming the student (author) of the solution to the assignment.
        user - The string naming the current user. That is, the name of the individual who invoked the message browser.
